Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2012 12:50PM Diane5 wrote: My birth mother died of breast cancer 30 years ago at the age of 38. I had a benign lumpectomy in '97, and bilateral ductal popalomas removed in 2000 & 2001. I had just gotten to the point where I wasn't embarased about the scars and dimples from that when I went for a mammogram on Dec 5th 2011. I hadn't had one in 3 years and knew better because of my high risk. I knew it wasn't good when my PA called me 20 minutes after I left from having my mamm done. The BS told me that my mamm looked like the milkeyway. She scheduled me for 5 Strerotactic Core Biopsies on Dec 15th with a follow up MRI two days latter. The result was ALH, but the MRI showed another spot. After waiting for the Post Biopsy trauma to dissipate she did another US a month ago. Seems that she did see the spot from the MRI, but decided to wait a month to do anything. Today I went in for another US and my BS ended up doing two more biopsies (US guided) today in her office. We are hopeful that it will be nothing, but I am still scared that they will find more. I find out next Monday (the day before my 39th birthday) what the results are from today. My BS is thinking that I may need an open surgical biopsy becuase of all the calcifications on my right side. That will be number 11. When do I say no more biopsies - remove the breasts? The stress of wondering is starting to get to me. Diane
Posts.Title: ALH farmerlucy Diane5

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2012 10:12PM Diane5 wrote: I just found this website and thread today.  Today was biopsy number 9 & 10 for me.  I find out the results on Monday the 26th (the day before my 39th birthday)  I am scared because my birthmother died of BC when she was 38 and i have always been afraid that I would be told I had cancer or die this year.  Stupid I know, but still real.  I was talking the other day with someone from RFL that it seems strange that there are no support groups for those of us waiting for results, just for those with a diagnosis.   I have read the messages on this thread and I am encouraged.  I know I am not alone.   Thank you!
